Brewer_Zombie_01.synopsis: A zombie who was once the waiter. He is stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.
Brewer_Zombie_01.how_to_trigger: Talk to the zombie next to the brewer. You may have to resolve the drinking competition with him first to acces Zombie 01's dialogue.

ResearchNotes.synopsis: Research notes of the Brewer.He experimented with different poisons on different creatures, trying to figure out the most effective ways of poisoning them. This book also contains info about his attempts to create a Purple Worm Poison.

PAD_Brewer_Poison.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Poison.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_POISON" status

PAD_Brewer_Drunk.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Drunk.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_DRUNK_02" status

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02.synopsis: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. Just wandering around.He's been trapped in the shadow-curse for a hundred years, and has been drained of most of his emotions. What lingers is a sense of sadness - he misses the joy of the old times.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03.synopsis: Zombie Patron #3 in BreweryTroubador singing/chanting drinking rhymes.

PAD_Brewer_Physical.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Physical.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_PHYSICAL" status

AD_HalflingsSign.synopsis: Plaque that says "Halfings and gnomes order here."
AD_HalflingsSign.how_to_trigger: Go to the Distillery.Click on the sign near the counter on the second floor.

PAD_Entrance_1P.synopsis: VB that is played when you approach the Distillery in SCL

AD_Brewer.synopsis: Brewer in Shadow-Cursed Town. Waiting for someone to join him as he stands behind the bar.The brewer was once an ordinary person, but has been twisted by the shadowcurse and is now a huge, bloated monstrosity. He speaks in fragments, and is menacing but with an air of melancholy. He wants to drink until he forgets everything, and would like to bring everyone into oblivion with him.
AD_Brewer.how_to_trigger: They play on a loop as he stands be hind the bar.goto -209, -84

AD_WaningMoonSign.synopsis: Click on the sign of Distillery in TWN

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04.synopsis: Zombie Patron #4 in Brewery. Used to be an actor, was on her way to Baldur's Gate. Like the other patrons in the brewery, she's been trapped in the shadow-curse for a hundred years, and is mostly drained of emotions.

PAD_Brewer_Fire.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Fire.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_FIRE" status

PAD_Brewer_CombatStarted.synopsis: Played at the start of a fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_CombatStarted.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the Brewer

PAD_Entrance_2P.synopsis: VB that is played when you approach the Distillery in SCL.Version for 2 characters.
PAD_Entrance_2P.how_to_trigger: Approach the Distillery in SCL with 2 characters

PAD_ArmInBarrel.synopsis: There is a barrel with an arm sticking out of it, Clicking on it makes the characters comment. The comment is different depending on whether the player has read the Brewer's diary.
PAD_ArmInBarrel.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_AClick on the Arm sticking out of a barrel at  - (-259 22 -101)

PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he summons a holyphant

PAD_Brewer_Cold.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Cold.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_COLD" status

PAD_Brewer_Acid.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Acid.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_ACID" status

PAD_BrewerDead.synopsis: In Town in Act 2 we meet the Brewer that is son of Ketheric and shadow-curse mutated. This one is played when we defeat him
PAD_BrewerDead.how_to_trigger: Load SCL_Main_Agoto -227; 15; -70Talk to Brewer, attack him

PAD_Brewer_Lightning.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Lightning.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_LIGHTNING" status

AD_Brewer_CanSeePlayer.synopsis: Brewer in Shadow-Cursed Town. Waiting for someone to join him as he stands behind the bar.The brewer was once an ordinary person, but has been twisted by the shadowcurse and is now a huge, bloated monstrosity. He speaks in fragments, and is menacing but with an air of melancholy. He wants to drink until he forgets everything, and would like to bring everyone into oblivion with him.
AD_Brewer_CanSeePlayer.how_to_trigger: They play on a loop as he stands be hind the bar.goto -209, -84

Brewer_Zombie_04.synopsis: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. This is an actor whose heart was set on the Five Flagons in Baldur's Gate, but he got lost in his cups here.
Brewer_Zombie_04.how_to_trigger: Go to TWN, Brewery, convince brewer not to kill you, talk to Zombie 04 ('Blighted Actor' on stage to the right of the Brewer).

PAD_Brewer_Necro.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_Necro.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_NECRO" status

Brewer.synopsis: Dialog with the Brewer. He is a bloated creature who asks us to drink ourselves into oblivion with him. Player choices lead either to combat, or to the brewer drinking himself until he explodes.Twisted and creepy, a jovial barman who has been corrupted by curse to become a monstrous drunk. He speaks in fragments, swinging between melancholy, menace, and humour. Extra emphasis and derangment on bold words.
Brewer.how_to_trigger: Approach the brewer on the main floor of the distillery.

Brewer_Zombie_03.synopsis: Billy, one of the zombie patrons of the brewer used to be a troubador. Here he is bellowing out a drinking song - may be improvises as a song or chanted.
Brewer_Zombie_03.how_to_trigger: Talk to Distillery_Brewer_Zombie_03 by the entrance to the distillery.

PAD_Brewer_PassedOut.synopsis: Played during the fight with the Brewer.
PAD_Brewer_PassedOut.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A-221; 15; -70Start a fight with the BrewerFight him until he gets "TWN_DISTILLERY_UNLOCK_DRUNK_03" status

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01.synopsis: Zomie waiter going through the motions, glitching out in a way, his words are all out of order.

Brewer_Zombie_02.synopsis: One of the zombie patrons in the Brewery. Just wandering around.
Brewer_Zombie_02.how_to_trigger: Talk to the zombie on the balcony. You may have to resolve the drinking competition with the brewer first to access Zombie 02's dialogue.

Brewer_Zombie_01_1.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01_1.text: Haul yourself up chum, and let the old whiskey jug b-b-bite you. So what'll it be?
Brewer_Zombie_01_1.context: NodeContext: Stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.

Brewer_Zombie_01_5.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01_5.text: Dark Mountain Right, moonin' come up. Proper t-taste m-man!

Brewer_Zombie_01_19.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01_19.text: Thisobald, you say? Indisposed, apologies is the master distiller c-currently.

Brewer_Zombie_01_20.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01_20.text: D-do mess our pardon. Our master d-distiller spill's quite the caused.

Brewer_Zombie_01_13.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01_13.text: Now settle your mind, chum, and get your shine on. Be will it what?

Brewer_Zombie_01_3.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01_3.text: M-moon Mountain Dark, coming righ-righ-right up. A man of proper t-taste!
Brewer_Zombie_01_3.context: NodeContext: Stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'.

Brewer_Zombie_01_2.speaker: Blighted Barman
Brewer_Zombie_01_2.text: Ch-chum yourself up, and whisk the old luggy j-jug bug you. So be what?
Brewer_Zombie_01_2.context: NodeContext: Stuck on repeat, going through the motions and 'glitching out'. Completely broken by now.

Brewer_Zombie_01_11.speaker: Lae'zel
Brewer_Zombie_01_11.text: Chk. The curse has left him with as much sense as a newborn slug.

Brewer_Zombie_01_17.speaker: Shadowheart
Brewer_Zombie_01_17.text: I think your witty remarks were too much for him - he's a blubbering wreck.
Brewer_Zombie_01_17.context: NodeContext: Wryly poking fun at the player (trying to converse with a zombie bar tender)

Brewer_Zombie_01_9.speaker: Karlach
Brewer_Zombie_01_9.text: So be what indeed, my friend. So be what indeed.
Brewer_Zombie_01_9.context: NodeContext: Mimicking the jibberish of a zomb

Brewer_Zombie_01_25.speaker: Astarion
Brewer_Zombie_01_25.text: Well that's disturbing. Still better than having an actual conversation with him, though.
Brewer_Zombie_01_25.context: NodeContext: Watching a zombie 'glitch out' and repeat nonsense phrases.

Brewer_Zombie_01_14.speaker: Wyll
Brewer_Zombie_01_14.text: I'd say you broke the poor fellow, but I wager he came that way.

Brewer_Zombie_01_21.speaker: Gale
Brewer_Zombie_01_21.text: Looks like he's not all there - in more ways than one.

Brewer_Zombie_01_24.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_01_24.text: Fine. How much do I owe you?

Brewer_Zombie_01_7.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_01_7.text: Who's the bloated carcass behind the bar?

Brewer_Zombie_01_18.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_01_18.text: Judging by the mess, I doubt there's much drink left.

Brewer_Zombie_01_6.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_01_6.text: 'Be will it what'? What are you saying?

ResearchNotes_2.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_2.text: *You set your eyes on the various formulas and copious notes.*

ResearchNotes_3.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_3.text: *The poison described within requires corpse rose petals. The distiller ordered a packet of them, but a dark purple stain makes the delivery destination hard to make out.*

ResearchNotes_6.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_6.text: *You set your eyes on the various formulas and copious notes.*
ResearchNotes_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises the book to look through it.

ResearchNotes_27.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_27.text: *The poison described within requires corpse rose petals. The distiller ordered a packet of them, but a dark purple stain makes the delivery destination hard to make out.*

ResearchNotes_14.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_14.text: *Research notes. They describe a powerful venom extracted from a rare purple worm. Distiller Thisobald Thorm sought to create a fatal poison using the worm's gullet.*
ResearchNotes_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises the book to look through it.

ResearchNotes_15.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_15.text: *He procured several parts of a worm gullet, but rinsed one in error. The poison he brewed was noxious - but not fatal.*

ResearchNotes_22.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_22.text: *Thisobald devoted months to formulating a deadly poison with the remaining ingredients, without success.*

ResearchNotes_26.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_26.text: *Research notes. They describe a powerful venom extracted from a rare purple worm. Distiller Thisobald Thorm sought to create a fatal poison using the worm's gullet.*

ResearchNotes_9.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_9.text: *He procured several parts of a gullet, but rinsed one in error. The poison he brewed was noxious - but not fatal.*

ResearchNotes_19.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_19.text: *He devoted months to formulating a deadly poison with the remaining ingredients, without success.*

ResearchNotes_4.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_4.text: *After exhaustive experimentation, he was able to make a near-deadly extract from the glands. But to complete his poison, Thisobald required one last ingredient:*

ResearchNotes_11.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_11.text: *The book's index reveals corpse roses may grow near tombs, mausoleums, and particularly redolent cadavers.*

ResearchNotes_16.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_16.text: *Thisobald enlisted a courier from Baldur's Gate to obtain corpse rose petals and other ingredients and deliver them to a covert location.*

ResearchNotes_21.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_21.text: *Unfortunately, a deep purple stain darkens the final page, obscuring the parcel's destination.*

ResearchNotes_10.speaker: Player
ResearchNotes_10.text: Focus your eyes on the page. Mentally separate the blank ink from the purple stain.

ResearchNotes_23.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_23.text: *Your mind separates the black from the blue, revealing the stash's location. You mark your map as a reminder.*

ResearchNotes_5.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_5.text: *With the corpse rose petals the package contains, you might create Thisobald's purple worm poison.*

ResearchNotes_24.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_24.text: *The location is revealed. And it seems you have already discovered the package.*

ResearchNotes_28.speaker: Narrator
ResearchNotes_28.text: *The page is a mess of dark colour. The delivery's location remains a mystery.*

PAD_Brewer_Poison_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Poison_0.text: Hells - his brew's turned to poison.

PAD_Brewer_Drunk_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Drunk_0.text: He's tottering. Another drink might knock him out.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_0.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_0.text: Finally, there might be some more drink for the rest of us.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_0.context: NodeContext: reflecting on the fact the brewer just died, but with little emotion

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_1.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_1.text: We used to dance. There used to be music.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_2.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_2.text: I wonder if they're looking for more staff now.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_2.context: NodeContext: reflecting on the fact the brewer just died, but with little emotion

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_3.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_3.text: Too much drink, too quickly. Bad.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_3.context: NodeContext: reflecting on the fact the brewer just died, but with little emotion

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_4.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_4.context: NodeContext: suspicious - just spotted new people

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_6.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_6.text: I wonder if the nurses will ever visit again. Their shift has lasted so long.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_7.speaker: Blighted Patron
AD_Brewer_Zombie_02_7.text: Thorm hated the bard's tunes. Maybe we'll get some proper music now.

AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_004_Combat_0.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_004_Combat_0.text: No no no. Not real. Not real!

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_0.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_0.text: Drink has torn his mortal stitches - Say, hey, for the pub!
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_0.context: NodeContext: referring to the brewer, who just died

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_1.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_1.text: There's that lass what I been peepin' - Say, hey, for the pub!

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_2.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_2.text: Now we get to loot his riches - Say, hey, for the pub!

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_3.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_3.text: Same as you - I see you're winkin' - Say, hey, for the pub!

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_4.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_4.text: The fat cat's burst out of his breeches - Say, hey, for the pub!
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_4.context: NodeContext: Sing song, bitter and mocking

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_5.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_5.text: The wife is out and the boys are sleepin' - Say, hey, for the pub!

AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_6.speaker: Blighted Troubador
AD_Brewer_Zombie_03_6.text: Hey! for the pub - Ho! for the pub - We'll soon be stinkin' drunk!

AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_001_Combat_0.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_001_Combat_0.text: Imps! No, no - illusions, delusions, delirium.

PAD_Entrance_1P_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P_0.text: That sign above. This must be a brewery - or distillery.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_0.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_0.text: Wait... what am I doing here again?

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_1.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_1.text: What a shame that we lost the brewer... I've already forgotten his name.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_3.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_3.text: I want a new drink. A new anything, really.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_4.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_4.text: Killed by the thing he loved. How deliciously dramatic.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_5.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_5.text: I can't remember where I wanted to go. Maybe I'm already there.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_6.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_6.text: Oh. A new face. How fun.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_7.speaker: Blighted Actor
AD_Brewer_Zombie_04_7.text: No more drink... I should hit the road. But I'm so tired.

AD_Brewer_Necro_Combat_0.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Necro_Combat_0.text: Drink of dead, dying, death. Order up.

PAD_Brewer_Fire_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Fire_0.text: Flaming brew? This battle's taken a heated turn.

PAD_Brewer_CombatStarted_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_CombatStarted_0.text: Expect anything - he's been cursed to the Hells and back.

PAD_Entrance_2P_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P_1.text: That sign above. This must be a brewery - or distillery.

PAD_Entrance_2P_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P_0.text: Hm. A place like this must hide all manner of secrets.

PAD_ArmInBarrel_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ArmInBarrel_0.text: Is that... a human arm? Do I even want to know?

PAD_ArmInBarrel_1.speaker: Player
PAD_ArmInBarrel_1.text: Oh - oh my. Must be what's left of that would-be extortionist.

PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Hallucinating_0.text: Is that... yes! His hallucinations made real.

PAD_Brewer_Acid_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Acid_0.text: Watch it - the acid's altered his brew.

PAD_BrewerDead_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BrewerDead_0.text: Pity we had to kill him. He seemed more lonely than cruel.

PAD_Brewer_Lightning_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_Lightning_0.text: Damn - the brew's acquired a spark!

AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_005_Combat_0.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_005_Combat_0.text: No! My eyes lie, deceive, falsify.

Brewer_Zombie_04_1.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_1.text: One day I'll get there... one day...

Brewer_Zombie_04_8.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04_8.text: What are you doing up here on this stage?

Brewer_Zombie_04_14.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_14.text: Isn't it obvious! I'm a... I stand on a stage, pretending...
Brewer_Zombie_04_14.context: NodeContext: hesitant, trying to find the right words, but is cursed to forget

Brewer_Zombie_04_13.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04_13.text: You mean you're an actor? How did you end up here?

Brewer_Zombie_04_11.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_11.text: I was... performing... and then the lights went out. I'm waiting for the curtain call.

Brewer_Zombie_04_12.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04_12.text: Please tell me you're not another minstrel.

Brewer_Zombie_04_0.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_0.text: How dare you! I'm an... actor! Yes! That's the word. A proper job, not some jester.

Brewer_Zombie_04_6.speaker: Player
Brewer_Zombie_04_6.text: Where is it you're trying to go?

Brewer_Zombie_04_4.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_4.text: Baldur's Gate! Where the streets sparkle with silver, and the actors have jobs.

Brewer_Zombie_04_10.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_10.text: There's a... big tent, funny costumes... circus! Yes, that's it... I was going to the circus...
Brewer_Zombie_04_10.context: NodeContext: forgetting words in the middle of speaking

Brewer_Zombie_04_2.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_2.text: I'm practicing my audition! Go away! Unless you're buying the next round...
Brewer_Zombie_04_2.context: NodeContext: flustered, but mock-friendly on the final line

Brewer_Zombie_04_5.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_5.text: The gore almost looks real. Superb! Encore!
Brewer_Zombie_04_5.context: NodeContext: enjoying the spectacle of a (real) death, thinking it's fake

Brewer_Zombie_04_9.speaker: Blighted Actor
Brewer_Zombie_04_9.text: I wish my audition piece was that exciting...
Brewer_Zombie_04_9.context: NodeContext: reacting to a spectacular death - no shock or horror, quietly impressed by the spectacle

Brewer_179.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brewer drags itself to a bar counter, on which are two full mugs.

Brewer_258.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_258.text: Drink, gulp it down, wet your whistle. Tell your story.
Brewer_258.context: NodeContext: Twisted and creepy, a jovial barman who has been corrupted by curse.

Brewer_288.speaker: Player
Brewer_288.text: What in all Nine Hells are you?

Brewer_49.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_49.text: Son of Thorm. Sot of Sword Coast.

Brewer_103.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_103.text: Go on. Cheers, bottoms up, down the hatch.
Brewer_103.context: NodeContext: still an offer, but becoming more of a threat

Brewer_291.speaker: Lae'zel
Brewer_291.text: Hells. The curse has twisted this man beyond measure...
Brewer_291.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_113.speaker: Shadowheart
Brewer_113.text: He's bloated like a corpse, and smells worse. Did the curse do this...?
Brewer_113.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_5.speaker: Karlach
Brewer_5.text: This guy looks like he had a long, long, long night. Might be best to keep him happy for now.
Brewer_5.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_33.speaker: Narrator
Brewer_33.text: *Leaning in, you can see how the creature's skin barely holds it together. The bulge of its belly is on the cusp of bursting wide open.*

Brewer_216.speaker: Lae'zel
Brewer_216.text: Near to bursting. The next few sips could be his last.
Brewer_216.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_300.speaker: Shadowheart
Brewer_300.text: He looks set to burst - and we'll probably be left hip-deep in his juices.
Brewer_300.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_292.speaker: Karlach
Brewer_292.text: Ew, gods, I do not want whatever's inside that guy all over me.
Brewer_292.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_167.speaker: Astarion
Brewer_167.text: Keep your distance. He looks like he could burst any second.
Brewer_167.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_268.speaker: Wyll
Brewer_268.text: Bloated as a pufferfish. He takes a few drinks, and I bet he'll pop.
Brewer_268.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_106.speaker: Gale
Brewer_106.text: Look at the thing... A few more tastes of its own medicine and it'll burst.
Brewer_106.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_289.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_289.text: Go on. Drink, make it drank, be drunk. You and I both, to our good health.
Brewer_289.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brewer takes up the other tankard. Holds it up in a toasting gesture.

Brewer_194.speaker: Narrator
Brewer_194.text: *The liquid burns your throat as you swallow, but otherwise, you feel no ill effects.*
Brewer_194.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grimaces after having drank the brewer's alcohol. It's potent, but they can handle it.

Brewer_162.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_162.text: Now tell me a story, a fable, a saga. Delight me.
Brewer_162.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brewer refills his mug from the vat on his back.

Brewer_121.speaker: Player
Brewer_121.text: I massacred an entire Grove of Tieflings who thought me their protector.

Brewer_165.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_165.text: The only one left alive to tell your wicked tale. Kill another drink with me.

Brewer_152.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_152.text: I stomp on the detritus of a dead town every day. Tell me of another life.

Brewer_189.speaker: Player
Brewer_189.text: I massacred an entire Grove of Tieflings who thought me their protector.

Brewer_257.speaker: Player
Brewer_257.text: I massacred an entire village of innocents who thought me their protector.

Brewer_154.speaker: Player
Brewer_154.text: I massacred an entire village of innocents who thought me their protector.

Brewer_2.speaker: Player
Brewer_2.text: From aboard a mind flayer vessel, I've witnessed the Hells themselves.

Brewer_145.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_145.text: So have I, when my cup runs dry. Let me pour you some sympathy.

Brewer_108.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_108.text: A wasted journey. The Hells can be seen right here.

Brewer_285.speaker: Player
Brewer_285.text: From aboard a mind flayer vessel, I've witnessed the Hells themselves.

Brewer_271.speaker: Player
Brewer_271.text: I gazed on nature's bounties in a verdant grove of druids.

Brewer_211.speaker: Player
Brewer_211.text: I gazed on nature's bounties in a verdant grove of druids.

Brewer_79.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_79.text: I am transported. I see the grove, the green, the grace before me!

Brewer_37.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_37.text: Beauty is boring, nature a nuisance. I am dulled, you are dullard.

Brewer_92.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_92.text: Spin a more fantastic fable. Entertain, engross, amuse me - or be amusement.

Brewer_267.speaker: Player
Brewer_267.text: I slaughtered a gold dragon and collected its vast hoard.

Brewer_65.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_65.text: Hoard, you say? Sounds like you can stand me a round or seven. But later...

Brewer_87.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_87.text: You ask. You drink. Then you amaze, enthuse, astound me. Again.

Brewer_41.speaker: Narrator
Brewer_41.text: *Your belly rumbles as the vile brew fills it, yet your mind remains miraculously steady.*
Brewer_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grimaces slightly from the alcohol, but is otherwise unaffected

Brewer_40.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brewer drains his tankard again before speaking

Brewer_107.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_107.text: Tell me of foes felled, villains vanquished, beasts bested.
Brewer_107.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brewer refills his tankard

Brewer_197.speaker: Player
Brewer_197.text: I have transformed into an ancient beast. One of pure hate.

Brewer_46.speaker: Player
Brewer_46.text: I have transformed into an ancient beast. One of pure hate.

Brewer_219.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_219.text: You have it within you still, I can tell from the crack in your smile and the gleam in your foul eye.

Brewer_129.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_129.text: Pah! Hate is not special. It takes no beast to hate. It is the raw state of every man.

Brewer_156.speaker: Player
Brewer_156.text: I ripped apart winged imps spawned from the fires of Avernus.

Brewer_130.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_130.text: Did they bleed flame? Did their screams rend the sky? No - don't tell me. Let me dream.

Brewer_159.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_159.text: Pathetic! Paultry! Poxy puddle of piddle! Why not boast of snots dug from your nostril?

Brewer_172.speaker: Player
Brewer_172.text: I ripped apart winged imps spawned from the fires of Avernus.

Brewer_34.speaker: Player
Brewer_34.text: An owlbear mother lunged at me. I slaughtered it in reply.

Brewer_10.speaker: Player
Brewer_10.text: An owlbear mother lunged at me. I slaughtered it in reply.

Brewer_50.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_50.text: Mothers. Commiserations. This place is my mother. Its teats are copper. Its milk is barrel-aged.

Brewer_157.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_157.text: We all have owlbear mothers. Mine was a lush. Unimpressive.

Brewer_62.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_62.text: No more blah, bland, banal. Give me blood. Or I take it.

Brewer_59.speaker: Player
Brewer_59.text: I disembowelled a balor with its own pointed horn.

Brewer_30.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_30.text: Horns - not just for supping from. What noises he must have made.

Brewer_134.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_134.text: Ask, question, make your query. And drink once more.

Brewer_241.speaker: Player
Brewer_241.text: Who placed the curse on this land?

Brewer_74.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_74.text: Father Ketheric created. Father Ketheric sustains.

Brewer_26.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_26.text: Drink it in, toss it down, lap it up.

Brewer_169.speaker: Player
Brewer_169.text: How did you become... what you are now?

Brewer_294.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_294.text: Father Ketheric's laughter. Not joy, not ever-never. Only laughter.

Brewer_44.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_44.text: Questions done, finished, over. Only drink.

Brewer_4.speaker: Player
Brewer_4.text: How do the Thorms sustain the shadows?

Brewer_207.speaker: Player
Brewer_207.text: What can you tell me about Ketheric?

Brewer_151.speaker: Player
Brewer_151.text: What do you mean? How can I defeat Ketheric?

Brewer_7.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_7.text: No, must not, can not, will not mention her.

Brewer_282.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_282.text: The customer is always right but also wrong.

Brewer_302.speaker: Narrator
Brewer_302.text: *Each swig is as painful as the last, but you remain in otherwise sound mind and body.*
Brewer_302.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grimaces from the alcohol

Brewer_286.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_286.text: I - I know you. I knew, I know, I am knowing.
Brewer_286.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brewer drinks once more after speaking, and lets out a belchNodeContext: Increasingly drunk, starting to rave

Brewer_181.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_181.text: You want father's personal mysterious - (secret) - secret. No, not, never!
Brewer_181.context: NodeContext: Starting to rave as a drunkard. The 'secret'in parentheses should be a loud whisper.

Brewer_223.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_223.text: Father said, ordered, commanded. Don't say it, don't say it! The cage. Her cage.

Brewer_39.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_39.text: Talk and... perish, die, buried. Buried in Thorm tomb. Father told me.
Brewer_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brewer drinks once more after speaking. He then lets out a deep, unsteady groan.NodeContext: Fully raving drunk.

Brewer_139.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_139.text: I can't perish - no, nay, neither. Too strong, too...
Brewer_139.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brewer groans in pain, then explodes in a shower of gore.NodeContext: Beyond drunk, about to die but denying it. Trails off at the end with a painful groan.

Brewer_253.speaker: Narrator
Brewer_253.text: *The third drink is too much. You're spinning down a black maelstrom toward the heart of oblivion. All goes dark.*
Brewer_253.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The player collapses to the floor, unconscious.

Brewer_224.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_224.text: You want father's personal mysterious - (secret) - secret. No, not, never!
Brewer_224.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smashes bar counter to end cinematic and transition into combatNodeContext: menacing, as you prepare to attack, smashing the bar counter in front of you

Brewer_140.speaker: Player
Brewer_140.text: Take a drink, but hold it in your mouth instead of swallowing.

Brewer_91.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brewer notices you’re not really drinking and he glares at you menacingly.

Brewer_281.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_281.context: CinematicNodeContext: brewer smashes bar with his fists before combat beginsNodeContext: building anger on each word, you're going to attack

Brewer_225.speaker: Player
Brewer_225.text: Swear eternal devotion to your divine as you knock back the drink.

Brewer_235.speaker: Player
Brewer_235.text: Channel your focus to a sharpened point as you drink.

Brewer_269.speaker: Player
Brewer_269.text: I ripped one head from an ettin and force-fed it to the other.

Brewer_239.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_239.text: Its eyes were not bigger than its belly, then? Hah! Delightful. A grisly tale with a frothing ale.

Brewer_205.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_205.text: Lies of a lying liar. Let void take you.
Brewer_205.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smashes bar counter to end cinematic and transition into combatNodeContext: menacing, as you prepare to attack, smashing the bar counter in front of you

Brewer_96.speaker: Player
Brewer_96.text: I conquered infamous hobgoblin Dror Ragzlin and his minions.

Brewer_233.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_233.text: Minions? Many - good. More blood to slurp and marrow to suck out.

Brewer_112.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_112.text: Hob-gob? Min-ion? Small beer. Small and sour. That tale does not wag.

Brewer_135.speaker: Player
Brewer_135.text: I conquered infamous hobgoblin Dror Ragzlin and his minions.

Brewer_212.speaker: Player
Brewer_212.text: I slayed a hideous, pustule-ridden hag. She died a gruesome death.

Brewer_18.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_18.text: Heh. Did you open her up and find the inner beauty? A wonderful tale. Fit for children.

Brewer_155.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_155.text: A waste of tongue flaps. I wanted glory, not pus!

Brewer_278.speaker: Player
Brewer_278.text: I slayed a hideous, pustule-ridden hag. She died a gruesome death.

Brewer_6.speaker: Player
Brewer_6.text: I challenged a daunting phase spider. Its corpse is all that remains.

Brewer_229.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_229.text: Foul creatures. Too many limbs - like seeing double, triple, quadruple. Better as husks.

Brewer_236.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_236.text: Do you adventure in broom closets? I want a saga.

Brewer_126.speaker: Player
Brewer_126.text: I challenged a daunting phase spider. Its corpse is all that remains.

Brewer_95.speaker: Player
Brewer_95.text: A bulette made me its prey, but proved no match for me.

Brewer_176.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_176.text: Boo-what? I do not know what that is. But let us imagine it impressive.

Brewer_202.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_202.text: What is that? A dessert wine? Unimpressive.

Brewer_290.speaker: Player
Brewer_290.text: A bulette made me its prey, but proved no match for me.

Brewer_298.speaker: Player
Brewer_298.text: A towering creature rose from molten lava. I felled it with great wit and might.

Brewer_61.speaker: Player
Brewer_61.text: A towering creature rose from molten lava. I felled it with great wit and might.

Brewer_29.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_29.text: Huh. Molten. Hot. Heavy. I saw such a beast in my latrine. A fierce foe.

Brewer_115.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_115.text: Any fool can grapple with hot rocks. Just poke a fireplace.

Brewer_131.speaker: Player
Brewer_131.text: I bested an inquisitor - a dreaded champion of the Lich Queen, Vlaakith.

Brewer_13.speaker: Player
Brewer_13.text: I bested an inquisitor - a dreaded champion of the Lich Queen, Vlaakith.
Brewer_13.context: InternalNodeContext: Bard advantage. Includes REALLY_GITHYANKI subnode.

Brewer_19.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_19.text: I'll drink to that. I drink to everything, but especially to that. Bravo.

Brewer_158.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_158.text: That's all? A single fight? Against a lone knight? Sounds like a stinking pile of...
Brewer_158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed shake of the head at the end.NodeContext: 'of shite' but trails off at the end with a sigh, unimpressed

Brewer_47.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_47.text: Feel unfeeling, know unknowing. Be devoured!
Brewer_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smashes bar counter to end cinematic and transition into combatNodeContext: menacing, as you prepare to attack, smashing the bar counter in front of you

Brewer_284.speaker: Narrator
Brewer_284.text: *The second drink hits you even harder. Nausea overwhelms you and it takes dire effort not to throw up all over the floor.*
Brewer_284.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grimaces and sways a little in reaction to the alcohol they just drank.

Brewer_102.speaker: Player
Brewer_102.text: Mime a sip of your drink.

Brewer_137.speaker: Player
Brewer_137.text: Take a sip, but spit out the liquour before the creature notices.

Brewer_232.speaker: Player
Brewer_232.text: As your drink, call upon your god to steady you.

Brewer_260.speaker: Player
Brewer_260.text: Fortify your spirit with a silent mantra as you drink.

Brewer_14.speaker: Player
Brewer_14.text: I gazed upon all Faerûn from the four peaks of the Spine of the World.

Brewer_193.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_193.text: Such a trek, for the sake of a view? I will drink to your iron knees.

Brewer_17.speaker: Player
Brewer_17.text: I walked the corpse of a dead god in the timeless Astral Plane.

Brewer_196.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_196.text: Adrift and unmourned, like a fly in red wine. Poetic.

Brewer_174.speaker: Player
Brewer_174.text: I've seen the goblins' vile rituals with my own eyes.

Brewer_60.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_60.text: A horror I can hardly bear, tolerate, endure, if only in my mind. Such daring!

Brewer_45.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_45.text: Insects, roaches, vermin all. I bore of their petty customs.

Brewer_175.speaker: Player
Brewer_175.text: I've seen the goblins' vile rituals with my own eyes.

Brewer_198.speaker: Player
Brewer_198.text: A silver-tongued devil bade me feast in his lavishly appointed banquet hall.

Brewer_56.speaker: Player
Brewer_56.text: A silver-tongued devil bade me feast in his lavishly appointed banquet hall.

Brewer_304.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_304.text: How I long for a feast. Eating, filling, gorging. Oh, to dine with devils!

Brewer_88.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_88.text: A devil is as he does. Promises, poetry, a story musty as must.

Brewer_228.speaker: Player
Brewer_228.text: I ascended a great tower infused with the most powerful of magic.

Brewer_1.speaker: Player
Brewer_1.text: I ascended a great tower infused with the most powerful of magic.

Brewer_237.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_237.text: The work of wizards. That crackle, that spark, how I wish it still stirred within me!

Brewer_146.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_146.text: I am Thorm. My father's tower grazed the new moon. Yours means zero, nothing, naught.

Brewer_117.speaker: Player
Brewer_117.text: I explored a lost fortress buried deep in the Underdark's bowels.

Brewer_52.speaker: Player
Brewer_52.text: I explored a lost fortress buried deep in the Underdark's bowels.

Brewer_109.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_109.text: Treasures in the dark, like the dusty anniversary bottle forgotten in the widow's cellar. Delightful. Delicious.

Brewer_57.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_57.text: Bowels? Speak not of bowels. My guts are a firestorm - but I have the means to douse it.

Brewer_295.speaker: Player
Brewer_295.text: I am the favoured vessel of an unknowably ancient creature.

Brewer_111.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_111.text: A deal most sordid for powers profane. To sign away your very self... Compelling.

Brewer_273.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_273.text: Of pacts and deals and dotted lines - this bores me. You bore me.

Brewer_36.speaker: Player
Brewer_36.text: No. I will not share any stories.

Brewer_245.speaker: Narrator
Brewer_245.text: *The creature's brew is more potent than anything you ever drank before. You feel instantly drunk and unsteady on your feet.*
Brewer_245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grimaces and sways a little in reaction to the alcohol they just drank.

Brewer_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grimaces as mimicking drinking. The brewer drinks after being convinced that the player was really drinking.

Brewer_118.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_118.text: Ah. Elixir. But such a small sip you take... Fear not. You will soon quaff as I do.
Brewer_118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brewer drinks deeply before speaking.NodeContext: Sigh of satisfaction, followed by a querying tone about why the player drinks so modestly (in fact they only pretended to drink)

Brewer_138.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_138.text: ...Not a single drop swallowed. You must think me a ripe fool.
Brewer_138.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brewer drinks, then frowns at the player

Brewer_128.speaker: Player
Brewer_128.text: Whisper a prayer to your god, then drink.

Brewer_270.speaker: Player
Brewer_270.text: Steady your body and mind, then drink.

Brewer_89.speaker: Player
Brewer_89.text: Pretend to swig deeply, avoiding the liquid at the last moment.

Brewer_272.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_272.context: CinematicNodeContext: brewer smashes bar with his fists before combat beginsNodeContext: Building anger. Combat ensues immediately afterwards.

Brewer_35.speaker: Astarion
Brewer_35.text: I've seen some grotesques in my time, but this is something else.
Brewer_35.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_104.speaker: Wyll
Brewer_104.text: The curse has wrecked this man. This is no life - this is torture.
Brewer_104.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_70.speaker: Gale
Brewer_70.text: Was this once a man? The shadows have corrupted him beyond comprehension.
Brewer_70.context: NodeContext: Discreetly murmured to the player (the being they're referring to is within earshot)

Brewer_120.speaker: Player
Brewer_120.text: What is it that you're serving?

Brewer_221.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_221.text: Only the best. Oblivion. And beyond.

Brewer_166.speaker: Player
Brewer_166.text: I already drank some wine earlier, thank you.

Brewer_147.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
Brewer_147.text: A pixie's piss. I give you Blackfire.

Brewer_Zombie_03_0.speaker: Blighted Troubador
Brewer_Zombie_03_0.text:
No time to waste, we should be drinkin'
Hey! for the pub
Ho! for the pub
We'll soon be stinkin' drunk!

Brewer_Zombie_03_1.speaker: Blighted Troubador
Brewer_Zombie_03_1.text:
The brew-man's popped, the floors are spattered
Say, hey, for the pub!
Drain your mug like nothing matters
Say, hey, for the pub!

Brewer_Zombie_03_2.speaker: Blighted Troubador
Brewer_Zombie_03_2.text:
The payday gold in my pouch is clinkin'
Say, hey, for the pub!
A single thought is what I'm thinkin'
Say, hey, for the pub!

AD_Brewer_Drunk_002_Combat_0.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Drunk_002_Combat_0.text: Too much drink. Too much drunk.

AD_Brewer_Fire_Combat_0.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Fire_Combat_0.text: Fire and flames, blaze and burn.

PAD_Brewer_PassedOut_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Brewer_PassedOut_0.text: He's down. Time to hit him with all I've got.

AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_003_Combat_0.speaker: Thisobald Thorm
AD_Brewer_Hallucinating_003_Combat_0.text: Ngh - more visions. Hells' things, imps' wings!

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_0.speaker: Blighted Barman
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_0.text: Sorry terrible, I'll c-c-clean up right mess that.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_0.context: NodeContext: referring to the fact the brewer just died - quietly amused

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_1.speaker: Blighted Barman
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_1.text: Renovations. P-please our clutter the pardon.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_1.context: NodeContext: musing - talking about the brewer, who just died

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_2.speaker: Blighted Barman
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_2.text: Have do a seat. Right will you be w-with I.

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_3.speaker: Blighted Barman
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_3.text: Special's is today the B-b-blackfire whiskey. How many bring I should?

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_4.speaker: Blighted Barman
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_4.text: Accept m-my please do apology, madam.
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_4.context: NodeContext: referring to the brewer-monster, who just exploded

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_5.speaker: Blighted Barman
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_5.context: NodeContext: musing - the previous brewer just died

AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_6.speaker: Blighted Barman
AD_Brewer_Zombie_01_6.text: W-welcome to The Waning Moon. Order have I may your?

Brewer_Zombie_02_0.speaker: Blighted Patron
Brewer_Zombie_02_0.text: I don't know you... perhaps I forgot you.

Brewer_Zombie_02_1.speaker: Blighted Patron
Brewer_Zombie_02_1.text: The distiller was here... now he's gone. Such is the way.

Brewer_Zombie_02_2.speaker: Blighted Patron
Brewer_Zombie_02_2.text: Maybe another sip would jog my memory...

Brewer_Zombie_02_3.speaker: Blighted Patron
Brewer_Zombie_02_3.text: He served us... but will be forgotten soon.
